intro: Gagea sintenisii, commonly known as the Sintenisi's gagea, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Eastern Mediterranean. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, preferring well-drained and sunny habitats. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that emerge from a basal rosette. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Gagea sintenisii is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
